investment_thesis.headline: B7-H3 is the leading next-gen ADC target with $22B Merck deal and limited normal tissue expression
key_points: Ideal ADC target: High tumor expression, minimal normal tissue expression
Merck mega-deal: $22B collaboration with Daiichi Sankyo for I-DXd
Multiple modalities: ADCs, CAR-T, bispecifics, radioconjugates all in development
Best clinical data: 52% ORR in ES-SCLC with ifinatamab deruxtecan
Regulatory momentum: BTD and ODD designations for lead programs
investment_thesis.full_text:
B7-H3 (CD276) is emerging as the premier target for next-generation oncology therapeutics, particularly antibody-drug conjugates. The immune checkpoint protein is highly expressed across multiple solid tumors (lung, prostate, breast, pediatric cancers) while showing minimal expression on normal tissues - making it an ideal target for cytotoxic payloads.

The Merck-Daiichi Sankyo $22B collaboration (October 2023) represents the largest ADC deal in history, validating the target's commercial potential. Lead asset ifinatamab deruxtecan (I-DXd, DS-7300) has shown impressive efficacy with 52% ORR in extensive-stage small cell lung cancer and is advancing through registrational trials.

The competitive landscape includes multiple modalities: ADCs from GSK, BioNTech, and Chinese biotechs; CAR-T programs from academic centers; bispecifics from MacroGenics; and the only approved radioconjugate omburtamab for CNS tumors. This diversity suggests confidence in the target across the industry.

mechanism.biology: B7-H3 is an immune checkpoint protein that inhibits T-cell activation and promotes tumor immune evasion. It is overexpressed in >70% of solid tumors.
mechanism.rationale: High tumor expression + low normal tissue expression = ideal therapeutic window for ADCs. The DXd payload has proven efficacy with Enhertu.
mechanism.unique_value: Unlike PD-L1 or HER2, B7-H3 is broadly expressed across tumor types with minimal toxicity concerns.

market_opportunity.target_share: $5-10B peak revenue potential for best-in-class B7-H3 ADC
market_opportunity.patient_population: Broad applicability: SCLC, NSCLC, prostate, breast, pediatric tumors
market_opportunity.unmet_need: ES-SCLC has no targeted therapies; 2L+ solid tumors need new options

key_risks.risk: Competition from other ADC targets (TROP2, HER3, etc.)
key_risks.mitigation: B7-H3 expression is broader and more consistent than alternatives

key_risks.risk: Merck/Daiichi dominance may crowd out other players
key_risks.mitigation: Differentiation through indication focus or modality

assets.name: Ifinatamab deruxtecan

deal.headline: Merck-Daiichi Sankyo collaboration
deal.notes: Includes I-DXd + 2 other Daiichi ADCs. Largest ADC deal ever.

assets.key_data: 52% ORR in ES-SCLC; 26% ORR in heavily pretreated solid tumors (ASCO 2024)
assets.differentiator: Best-in-class DXd payload; deep Merck partnership; most advanced

assets.name: Risvutatug rezetecan
assets.differentiator: Chinese-origin ADC with strong efficacy data; GSK global development

assets.name: YL201
assets.differentiator: Competitive China ADC with strong Phase 1/2 data

assets.name: Vobramitamab duocarmazine
assets.key_data: 40% PSA50 response rate in mCRPC; differentiated prostate focus
assets.differentiator: Only B7-H3 ADC with duocarmazine payload; prostate cancer focus

assets.name: Omburtamab
assets.key_data: BLA filed Oct 2022; PDUFA extended; Phase 3 for DIPG
assets.differentiator: Only radioconjugate; CNS penetration; pediatric focus

assets.name: Enoblituzumab
assets.key_data: Fc-enhanced for ADCC; combination with retifanlimab (PD-1)

assets.name: MGD024
assets.modality_detail: DART (Dual-Affinity Re-Targeting) B7-H3 x CD3 bispecific

assets.name: SCRI-CARB7H3 (Seattle CAR-T)
assets.modality_detail: CAR-T for CNS tumors with intrathecal delivery

efficacy_comparison.notes: Impressive early data from Chinese program
